snippet: The group has been laying ideological groundwork to maintain its appeal as it suffers on the battlefield....
abstract: Islamic State, losing ground to United States-backed forces in Iraq and Syria, has begun switching its focus to long-term battle and survival; group has been adjusting messages to its followers accordingly, announcing prophetic battle in Dabiq, Syria, is still to come despite fact that village has already been retaken by Syrian rebels.

byline.contributor: Maher Samaan contributed reporting from Paris, Hwaida Saad from Beirut, and an employee of The New York Times from Damascus, Syria.

lead_paragraph: The group has been laying ideological groundwork to maintain its appeal as it suffers on the battlefield.

headline.main: After Losses in Syria and Iraq, ISIS Moves the Goal Posts
headline.print_headline: Losing Territory, ISIS Keeps Sights on Longer Fight

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
